Package group.tcpclient

Class MyClient

java.lang.Object
group.tcpclient.MyClient
public class MyClient extends Object
This class provides a functionality to interact with an echo server.
Author:
Paul

  • Constructor Details

    • MyClient

      public MyClient(MyClient.ClientCallback callback, String serverName, int port) throws Exception
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      callback - Implementer of the interface. Usually "this"
      serverName - Network name of the server. Could be an IP address.
      port - Port used by the server.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the constructor parameters are bad

  • Method Details

    • makeConnection

      public boolean makeConnection(boolean keepTrying, int timeoutMillis)
      Attempts to connect to the server
      Parameters:
      keepTrying - If True it will keep trying until success or timeout. Otherwise it tries only once.
      timeoutMillis - If retrying, this specifies a timeout. If less than or equal to 0 then it retries indefinitely. Indefinite retries will NOT work for the loopback address 127.0.0.1, which will eventually (after many attempts)report success without a server. The input stream will be connected to the output stream. So if you want indefinite retries, and the server is known to be on this same machine, then use this host address instead, which you can obtain from getMyAddress(false)).
      Returns:
      whether the connection was successful.

    • sendMessage

      public boolean sendMessage(String msg, int timeoutMillis)
      Send a message to the server.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to be sent. If the server has not yet been connected it attempts to make one with an optional timeout.
      timeoutMillis - Applies only to making a connection. If a connection exists this is ignored. If less than 0 only 1 attempt is made. If equal 0, the connection will wait indefinitely. If greater than 0 it is the number of milliseconds to wait for a connection.
      Returns:
      False if a timed connection attempt fails. Otherwise true.

    • sendMessageGetResponse

      public String sendMessageGetResponse(String msg, int connectTimeout, int messageTimeout)
      Sends a message to the server and waits for a response, with an optional timeout. If the server has not yet been connected it will attempt to do so, with an optional timeout. See the description of makeConnection().
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to be sent.
      connectTimeout - Applies only to making a connection. If a connection exists this is ignored. If less than 0 only 1 attempt is made. If equal 0, the connection will wait indefinitely. If greater than 0 it is the number of milliseconds to wait for a connection.
      messageTimeout - Timeout in msec for response wait. If less than or equal to 0 it will wait indefinitely.
      Returns:
      The response message or null if an attempted connection or wait for a response times out.

    • waitForMessage

      public String waitForMessage(int timeoutMillis)
      Waits for a message from the server, with optional timeout. If a specified timeout expires, it returns null, otherwise it returns the message.
      Parameters:
      timeoutMillis - Timeout time in milliseconds. If less than or equal to 0 then wait indefinitely.
      Returns:
      The received message. Null if the wait times out or an IOException occurs.

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection()
      Closes the connection. This should be called before exiting the program.

    • getMyAddress

      public static String getMyAddress(boolean loopback)
      Returns one of two IP addresses for this host.
      Parameters:
      loopback - If false, returns this host IP address. Otherwise it returns the reported loopback address. This is one of the 127.*.*.* addresses, almost always 127.0.0.1, but not guaranteed to be so.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the IP address
